ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] rel=nofollow
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Tom, I don t see an easy to accomplish that currently. If I were going to code such a feature, I would let ExtractorHTML extract the link normally, and

Hello Tom,

I don't see an easy to accomplish that currently.

If I were going to code such a feature, I would let ExtractorHTML 
extract the link normally, and then have a scope rule, perhaps a 
ScriptedDecideRule, reject the url from further processing. That 
technique can't work today because the scope rule has no way of knowing 
that the link came from a a[@rel='nofollow']/@href, as far as I can see 
after a quick look. CrawlURI.linkContext would seem to be a logical 
place for that information, and HTMLLinkContext could be enhanced to 
that effect.

Noah

On 07/24/2011 11:38 AM, Tom Zeithaml wrote:
> Hello,
> Is it possible to skip<a ... rel=nofollow Links ?
>
> Maybe a workaround in org.archive.crawler.extractor
> Class ExtractorHTML is possible ?
>
> best regards
> Tom
